alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa Inland; Santa Rosa Inland (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 17 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Escambia, southern Covington, Okaloosa and northeastern Santa Rosa Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 349 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles northwest of Laurel Hill to 7 miles east of Roeville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crestview, Florala, Baker, Laurel Hill and Lockhart. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
